name: resynthesis
content:
resynthesis noun [U]
(CHEMICAL PRODUCTION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
chemistry
  specialized the process of producing a substance from simpler materials after a chemical reaction again: Calcium plays an important role in regulating the resynthesis of cGMP by guanylate cyclase. This process avoids the need for re-synthesis of many different compounds.
More examplesFewer examplesFollowing absorption, choline and cytidine are dispersed throughout the body, enter systemic circulation for utilization in various biosynthetic pathways, and cross the blood-brain barrier for re-synthesis into citicoline in the brain.

resynthesis noun [U]
(SOUND PRODUCTION)
physics
  specialized the process of producing sound electronically again: The sound of the human voice is perceived as "closed" after resynthesis. the use of technology in the processes of sound analysis and resynthesis
More examplesFewer examplesThe task of resynthesis passes to the performer, who will use electronic or acoustic instrumental resources as they decide is appropriate.The same voices that were used for keying in the data are used for this resynthesis process.The pitch track of each source utterance was manipulated to produce, by resynthesis, two groups of five experimental utterances for each speaker.
